issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
I can reproduce on uBO since we are using `trusted-click`. This rule fixes it on my side:

```adb
akakce.com##body > div[id][class]:has(> .app > div > .app_btn[onclick="openApp();"])
```

Should we put it inside `ext_ublock`?

comment.body: Test sites like those have been (from what I'm aware of) contentious at best among the larger adblock teams, since we'd/they'd have to take the test sites' words for it at face value that the sites would need to be blocked, without the test sites being able to demonstrate instances where the checked sites have a visible effect on non-"test site" sites.

issue.title: Duplicati Windows App

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.20.2 (4988)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://github.com/duplicati/duplicati

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Block Location API, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests, Protect from DPI, Hide your search queries

### Add your comment and screenshots

I got a UI problem when using the Duplicati Windows version application with the AdGuard Base filter enabled while running web-based ui.

In the applications, the final "Save" button disappears during the backup addition process.

When I disable the AdGuard Base filter (while keeping all other filters enabled), the missing button reappears as shown in the screenshot, thus solving the UI problem. I have not been able to find a solution using user filters.

This may be a complex issue, but I would appreciate it if you could look into it. I have included a link to the source code for the button where the problem occurs in Duplicati for additional reference.

https://github.com/duplicati/duplicati/blob/8c6ed9cbba5fd4051ef43d4f921e3ea577f362a4/Duplicati/Server/webroot/ngax/templates/addoredit.html#L409-L412

Screenshots

<details><summary>Screenshot 1 (Problem screen):</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/63ebdfd6-78a9-4d17-bd2d-6c5a9160050d)

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2 (Normal screen):</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/75752bda-e929-4b0a-80a9-d67971070b36)

</details>


### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
@LI-NA Hi. Do you see errors in console?

Please copy an address of the page from AdGuard filtering log.

You may test these rules in user rules one by one:

`@@||localhost:8200^$jsinject`
`@@||localhost:8200^$stealth`
`@@||localhost:8200^$elemhide`
`@@||localhost:8200^$jsinject,elemhide`
`@@||localhost:8200^$content`

or with `127.0.0.1` instead of `localhost` (`@@||127.0.0.1:8200^$jsinject`)

If you mean that:
>despite trying to manually block an ad by right clicking or from the pinned extensions by the url, the "element blocking" box does not pop up to show any possible changes that could be made

then I cannot reproduce it, so please report it here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues

<hr>

Regarding ad placeholder, it has been fixed but MV3 extension cannot update filters so new rule will be available in one of the next extension version.
Until then you can add following rule to user rules:
```adblock
mydramalist.com##.app-body > div[class] > div[class*="is-"]:has(> .htlad-header_top:only-child)
```

issue.title: Recommendations for Adguard Chinese filters
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

在Adguard浏览器扩展中有好几个与中文相关的过滤器，我觉得可以合并成一个过滤器。目前Adguard中文过滤器是基于Easylist china的，可以合并其它过滤器。

### Proposed solution

如图，下面这两个过滤器也是负责中文内容的，可以与Adguard 中文过滤器合并。现在的中文过滤器是基于Easylist china的，可以改成同时基于三个过滤器
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/97d933a4-38aa-4fee-a15c-1fa5eaab4307)

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: Users can enable the necessary filters.

comment.body:
FPs are not limited to that site.
A follow-button is hidden: `http://www.all-nationz.com/`
User-count is hidden: `http://vipsister23.com/`

Frankly, I don't like these generic `href` rules. They tend to cause FP and be performance burden. Compared to FB Social, we have dozens times more of such rules, which I don't think all necessary. I'm thinking to cleanup and reorganize them.

@ameshkov Sorry, can you share the stats for those generic cosmetic filters in Social filter?

comment.body:
Hi,

Per information, i succeeded in resolving the issue.
I just enable option which allow to filter via https only websites in defined list and add desired urls.

I have also remove all existing urls like google and others from the list.

Finally, i add msn application to https filtered applications.

Then issue was resolved.

Thanks,
François-Régis

comment.body:
Fixed in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/c4be9aea3eed76ea6e8db206c146d85c9f45075b, but the problem is that MV3 extension cannot update filters, so new rules will be available in one of the next extension updates.
Until then, please add following rules:
```adblock
||html-load.com^$script,redirect=noopjs,domain=ldoceonline.com
ldoceonline.com#%#//scriptlet('remove-node-text', 'script', 'html-load.com')
```
to user rules.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Cleanup duplicate rules in MobileFilter (specific_web.txt)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

There are multiple duplicate rules in the filters.

- [ ] ###ad-wrapper__mobile-bottom-adhesion
- [ ] ###meerkat-wrap
- [ ] ###mobile_text-2
- [ ] ###recents > div.inner
- [ ] ###slide_wrap
- [ ] ###sp_article_billboard
- [ ] ###sp_top_head
- [ ] ##.Banner
- [ ] ##.StickyAd
- [ ] ##.ad
- [ ] ##.ad-inread
- [ ] ##.ad-mobile
- [ ] ##.ad_sp
- [ ] ##.ads-bottom__fixed
- [ ] ##.ads-top__fixed
- [ ] ##.adsbygoogle
- [ ] ##.advertising
- [ ] ##.amp-flying-carpet-text-border
- [ ] ##.article-detail_tag_ad_mobile_video_recommend
- [ ] ##.article-detail_tag_content_billboard_mobile
- [ ] ##.b-top-container
- [ ] ##.banner
- [ ] ##.fxs_stickyAd-mobile
- [ ] ##.header__item
- [ ] ##.header_dlsite
- [ ] ##.iqdcontainer
- [ ] ##.mobileads
- [ ] ##.pop-fade
- [ ] ##.single_ads
- [ ] ##.wrapper_banner
- [ ] ##amp-fx-flying-carpet
- [ ] ##article[data-teaser-type="unspecified_group"]
- [ ] ##body .ccmcss_oas_top
- [ ] ##center > a[target="_blank"] > img
- [ ] ##div[class^="ad"]
- [ ] ##div[class^="contentAd"]
- [ ] ##div[class^="mobile-bottom-sticky"]
- [ ] ##div[data-logger="PortalMenuPromo"]
- [ ] ##div[id^="ad"]
- [ ] ##div[style="min-height:100px;"]
- [ ] ##header + center

```
hoerzu.de##.ad-mobile
pcgamesn.com##.ad-mobile
sozcu.com.tr#?#.ad-mobile
```
```
wetter.com##div[id^="somtag-container"]
wetter.com#?#div[id^="somtag-container"]
```
```
tvtropes.org##.proper-ad-unit
gamepur.com#?#.proper-ad-unit
```
```
xn--dkqp0gri91r38rn1wmlurtz.com,gigazine.net,medicinenet.com,rxlist.com,wap.lexun.com###ad
seikeidouga.blog.jp#?##ad
```

### Proposed solution

Merge or remove rules if possible.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
`##` and `#?#` are different, so
```
tvtropes.org##.proper-ad-unit
gamepur.com#?#.proper-ad-unit
```

is not a duplicate.

issue.title: www.ebay.co.uk
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.ebay.co.uk/sch/i.html?_nkw=weed+control&_sacat=0&_trksid=p4432023.m570.l1313](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ebay.co.uk%2Fsch%2Fi.html%3F_nkw%3Dweed%2Bcontrol%26_sacat%3D0%26_trksid%3Dp4432023.m570.l1313) ### Comment > I was on ebay.co.uk and just did a search for weed fabric. hit the search button it displayed everything apart from the images in the search result, I noticed that when I refreshed the page thinking that might help that it seems to get stuck on the transferring data from ir.ebaystatic.com. > > I tried turning off Privacy Badger, uBlock Origin and then Adguard finally which was when it allowed all the images to be displayed. > > I then re-enabled them all one at a time and went through a combination to determine that it was something Adguard doesn't like. ### Screenshots

### Language-specific

List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Block Location API, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests, Protect from DPI, Hide your search queries

### Add your comment and screenshots

I got a UI problem when using the Duplicati Windows version application with the AdGuard Base filter enabled while running web-based ui.

In the applications, the final "Save" button disappears during the backup addition process.

When I disable the AdGuard Base filter (while keeping all other filters enabled), the missing button reappears as shown in the screenshot, thus solving the UI problem. I have not been able to find a solution using user filters.

This may be a complex issue, but I would appreciate it if you could look into it. I have included a link to the source code for the button where the problem occurs in Duplicati for additional reference.

https://github.com/duplicati/duplicati/blob/8c6ed9cbba5fd4051ef43d4f921e3ea577f362a4/Duplicati/Server/webroot/ngax/templates/addoredit.html#L409-L412

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2 (Normal screen):</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/75752bda-e929-4b0a-80a9-d67971070b36)

</details>

comment.body:
@Alex-302 Thank you for your response.

I was testing the filtering behavior as you suggested, but after updating the filters and restarting the program during my tests, I can no longer reproduce the issue.

Before restarting the program, there were no errors showing in the console, and none of the user filter rules you suggested resolved the problem. The only solution that worked at that time was disabling the AdGuard Base Filter.

I'm not sure whether it was the filter update or the program restart that resolved the issue... Since the problem has resolved itself, I will close this issue. If the problem reoccurs in the future, I will investigate more thoroughly and open a new issue with more detailed information. I apologize for any confusion this may have caused.

This PR updates filter rules to fix subscription widgets on Substack-based sites.  
- Updates the subscribe-widget filter to include new blog domains.  
- Modifies the home-sitemap-signup-form filter to include corresponding new domains while removing an exclusion for read.engineerscodex.com.
